Reviews.Title: It's a fine camera, and please be a knowledgeable reviewer
Reviews.Author: Herbert H. Yau
Reviews.Content: Let me start with a little "complaint" here: People are unnecessarily ruining the reputation of a perfectly good camera because they don't know what they are talking about.  So, if you haven't owned/used a range of photographic equipment or have some knowledge/skill/abilities in photography, don't write a review.Quick summery: It's a great camera for the price range.  It is reasonable rugged, easy to use, and has good picture quality.  If you want to buy this camera as a beater, glovebox camera or as your pre-teen son/daughter's first camera it is excellent.Rebuttal to the earlier reviewers:-First, you are expected to get a new memory card as you get a new camera.  They are very cheap nowadays.  Expecting a new memory card is like expecting having a full tank of gas in new car as you pull it out of the dealer's lot.  It's nice, but the maker has ZERO obligation to do so.-Some complains about pictures being too big.  That's like someone buys a new big house then complains about the front yard being too big!  Big file size is the function of a high quality image.  Get yourself a new bigger memory, hard driver, etc....  There's no free lunch.-Even the best digital cameras (I'm talking about cameras costing about 20x of this one) has problems with dynamic range (the "distance" between the brightest and darkest parts of a photo).  As a photographer, you are obligated to watch for bright, harsh lights and take measures to solve the problem.  I used the camera under many different conditions and I don't see this camera being overly bad in terms of dynamic range.-I'm using a 16GB card and I can hold 3700+ pictures (a 16GB can be had for about $25 nowadays) so that should be enough pictures for at least a day's shooting.I have been a photographer since high school, and worked as one in various capacities (weddings, event coverage, portraits, etc...)since.  My last point-and-shoot was stolen in a car break-in so I will need a replacement.General comment:-Picture/optical quality: It's very serviceable.  Of course, for its price the picture quality aren't as good as more expensive point-and-shoot and my DSLR (Nikon D7000).  However, it's superior to any phone camera.  The zoom range is decent, and the macro works well.-Video: It can make 720P (HD) video and it's a sufficient quality for most purpose.-One set of fresh fully charged AA NiMH batteries last at least for a day of shooting.  I haven't collect any data on number of pictures per charge so I can't give anything more precise.-Indoor/low light shooting: This is the area where ALL point-and-shoot will suffer.  If you don't want to use flash in those situations, be prepared for grainy images.  Again, this is common to ALL point-and-shoot so it's not unique for this camera.Thumbs up:-Uses AA batteries: You can buy AA batteries anywhere and you can use rechargeables AA batteries.  No expensive proprietary rechargeables batteries to buy.-Small and light: It fits into a shirt pocket, cargo shorts pockets easily.  It is bigger in terms of volume than the smallest cameras on the market but it is very light.-Ergonomics:  Buttons are big and legible.  I can operate most controls even with my fingered cycling gloves on.  The shutter button is big and feels good to the finger.  All controls are where you expected them to be.-Noise level: The motors operates almost silently so it's good when you have to use the camera in discreet environment.-Menu layout: If you are previously a Canon user, it is the same as before.  However, it added addition help statements to tell you want each function does.-Auto-focus: As for any Canon, the auto-focus is fast and accurate.Thumbs down (mostly very minor):-The battery cover can come off if you handle the camera wrong once in a blue moon.  You can always use some tape to tape the door down if that happens too often.-Lacks Aperture Priority/Shutter Priority modes.  Theses are more advanced functions that Canon took out for this entry level camera.  That's a bummer for more advanced users.  If you don't know what I am talking about, it's ok as it won't affect you one bit.Final Words:If you want a cheap, "beater" camera, or the first camera for a pre-teen that runs on AA batteries (highly recommend using rechargeables), it is a fantastic camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent pocket camera
Reviews.Author: jmcguire
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a "go-anywhere" camera to carry with me when lugging the big DSLR and all its associated hardware (does stuff just grow in the gadget bag when you're not looking?) was impractical. So far, it has performed admirably.A big feature for me was the use of AA batteries. While the cameras with rechargeable batteries are more compact, the AA capability lets me get new batteries for it anywhere if necessary. That can be extremely important, especially on a trip, and was worth trading a bit of size for. Between the AA batteries and standard SD card slot, it doesn't need anything I can't get at Walgreen's.The only real negative to me is the lack of instant-access controls and settings, with almost all of them being on-screen now. While that's the default nowadays, and it does have some advantages for reliability (not to mention real estate when most of the back of the camera is LCD screen) it is definitely slower than just turning a dial to switch modes. Still, for the average user who probably doesn't need to change them in an instant, this is not likely to be an issue.All in all, an excellent pocket camera for the price. Definitely highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Point & Shoot for the price
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine, takes excellent pictures even though they look very grainy in the display screen before you take the shot. I love that it takes only 2 AA batteries, so I didn't have to bother with spending extra money on a special extra battery. I did have a problem with the software that comes with the camera; it refused to work or open; so I deleted it and just used the programs already installed in my macbook. The batteries tend to fall out when you remove the SD card to put it in your card reader, so I ended up using the USB cable and downloaded directly from the camera using PREVIEW and IMAGE CAPTURE, both Apps that were already on my Mac. Already a Powershot user, I found the menu's easy to use and of course the new help button reminded me of what I'd forgotten. I'd recommend this camera for casual point and shoot situations where an SLR is overkill. It also does a great job capturing written documents with clarity (something I do often) that rivals my SLR when it comes to clarity. Although the software was frustrating when it didn't work and froze my laptop, the camera itself is great. I'd say I'm pleased overall with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Cheap reliable Camera
Reviews.Author: jcg
Reviews.Content: I bought this with a little trepidation and $60 which is pretty cheap for a 16mp camera. Some people complained about image quality in other reviews but I noticed this only on the cameras screen NOT on the computer.  Sometime however if you move while taking the picture it will come out blurry, but its noticeable on the camera's screen. It does not come with a memory card (MicroSD) so you'll have to pick one up. I wouldn't recommend buying a MicroSD less than 4gb, as the pictures can be pretty big and the video can take up a lot since it is 720. The video function is quite good and quite frankly I should use it more.A good thing about the camera is that it uses AA batteries, making in convenient (I had a Nikon with a special battery which was really annoying, especially when it ran out of charge and you have to wait for it to charge).  The battery life seemed to be not bad as well.It has a mini usb cord that you can plug into the camera so you don't have to have a memory card reader on your computer.

Reviews.Title: amazing camera awesome price
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I bought thus camera for my fiance as a birthday present. We have taken it kayaking, to the beach, and out bar hopping. It takes great pictures and video no matter what the atmosphere. I highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I'm trained in art and photography, and I sort of have a thing for cameras. My wife, on the other hand is not into anything technical. She needed a simple point and shoot with good video and sound for when our grand daughter visits.I am a big fan of Canon, so I began my search there. The reason I settled on this one was the BATTERIES. I think a simple pocket point and shoot should use AA batteries, it's much more practical for the casual user, just use rechargeables. The great thing about AA is that if you're out at the zoo or somewhere and your batteries go dead, you can find them anywhere.After comparing this camera to the other Canons in it's price range, this was the right choice, the little bulge for the batteries actually make it easier to handle in my opinion. It's a great little camera for what I paid, takes very good pictures and videos, it's simple to use, easy to store, and it uses AA BATTERIES! I wish more cameras did.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my sister who had previously owned a Nikon Cool Pix that she didn't like because it had too many bells and whistles and it was a touch screen that annoyed her.  Long story short she dropped the Nikon and it broke so I told her I'd order something I thought she would like better.  Easy to use right out of the box and takes great photo.  Has video and that too is simple to use.  If you are looking for a nice basic point and shoot don't hesitate to purchase this one.  I own 5 Canons and each one from the point and shoot to the Rebel is a great camera, you can,t go wrong with a Canon

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Tom Sawyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace one I thought was lost at work.  The price was the most important consideration and it had to be a Canon.  I bought this on the strength of a couple of favorable reviews and had no particular expectations. So, I was very pleasantly surprised when it arrived.The camera is small and light.  It is smaller than I expected and is thin.  It is all plastic and feels sturdy.  It has no viewfinder.  The LCD screen is large for a camera this small and shows good detail in outdoor light.  The quality falls off in low or indoor light.  The camera is easy to hold in one or two hands and has a substantial bump under the shutter release to grip.  There is no texture to assist you in gripping the camera, but the bump has a defined edge you can grip with fingertips. My biggest complaint is having the on-off button right next the shutter release.  The buttons are the same color and texture and differ only in size making them easy to confuse.The camera powers up quickly.  The menu system is easy to access, you put the camera in "Live" mode and you can access all the special shooting modes by repeatedly pressing the thumb dial.  In "Auto" mode the camera chooses the mode for you.  I found "Auto" mode adequate to most of my needs except when taking pictures of people, then I prefer the "Portrait" mode.  Recording movies is simple, just push the red button.  I have not used the movie mode extensively.  The zoom lever is around the shutter release where I prefer it.  The camera comes with the digital zoom set to on.  The digital zoom cannot be turned off in "Auto" mode which is a feature I dislike.  It can be turned off in "Live" mode.After years of lugging SLRs and superzooms around I decided to downsize to smaller cameras a couple of years ago. The pictures the A810 takes have well saturated color and plenty of detail for viewing on a screen or prints up to 8x10.  Actually for a camera as small and as inexpensive as this is I find the picture quality amazing.  Compared to the cameraphones most people use it takes stunning pictures.  On my laptop screen it takes pictures that are as good as those made with my superzoom.  I give up some zoom range and lens speed,but gain a camera that fits in a pocket.  I get that convenience without giving up much image quality.For the price and size I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Lying with Accurate Claims
Reviews.Author: Peter Besenbruch
Reviews.Content: My son received a Canon PowerShot A810 as a gift. It's a 16 megapixel camera with a 28-140mm (35mm equivalent) zoom. Canon also sells the PowerShot G15. It's a 12 megapixel camera with a zoom of 28-140mm. It's bigger and clunkier, and a lot more expensive. Why would anyone buy the G15, when they could have the A810? The answer to that question illustrates what is wrong with the A810, and the way cameras are advertised.Here are some specifications for the A810:Sensor 1/2.3" (the smallest standard size)Lens Aperture: f2.8 (wide) to f6.9 (telephoto, very slow)Resolutions available: 16MP: 4608 x 3456, 8MP: 3264 x 2448, 2MP: 1600 x 1200, 0.3MP: 640 x 480This camera is capable of producing enormous images at potentially very high resolution. It can't achieve these resolutions. It can't even come close. There are two reasons for this:1) A 1/2.3" sensor is very densely packed. That means far fewer photons to strike each pixel. To compensate the manufacturer has to turn up the gain on the chip. The more density, the more gain needed. The more gain, the more noise. At 16 megapixels, this camera has such densely packed pixels that even ISO 100 shots are noisy. Canon can either let the user live with the noise, or apply noise reduction. Noise reduction is useful if done well and selectively. Here noise reduction smears the image, getting rid of SOME of the noise. Think of it: At ISO 100, you get noise and smearing. The problem worsens as the ISO value goes up.2) A 16 megapixel, 1/2.3" sensor demands a lens capable of high resolution. You don't get that with this camera. First, the lens is cheaply made. It isn't bad for a cheap lens, but it will not perform up to its potential specification. Those specifications are are pretty low to begin with:If you do a search for the terms "diffraction" and "digital camera" you will get pages that have diffraction limit calculators for various digital camera formats. Diffraction is a property that has been well understood for centuries. For cameras, the higher the F-ratio of a lens, the more diffraction it introduces, and the less detail shows up on your pictures.For this camera, the sensor might benefit from a perfect lens if the lens were f2.6 or lower. As I stated above, the lens at wide angle is f2.8, and at telephoto is f6.9.To use this lens, you need to drop the camera's resolution. F6.9 supports a resolution of between 2-3 megapixels, given a perfectly made lens. Now look at what the camera makes available: 16, 8, 2, and 0.3 megapixels. At 8 megapixels, you can shoot wide angle shots with this lens, but normal (40+mm) through telephoto shots only achieve the resolution of the lens at 2 megapixels. Try to push the resolution higher, and you will get empty megapixels, lots of them. Indeed, the A810 is one of the most extreme examples on the market of a camera promising something it can't come close to delivering.The level of lying in the marketing of this camera is breathtaking.What about that other camera I mentioned, the Canon G15 that sells for over $500? It comes with a larger sensor, a 1/1.8", and fewer megapixels, 12. Its lens' f-ratio ranges from f1.8 (wide) to f2.8 (telephoto). Plug those values into a diffraction calculator, and you have a camera that can take full advantage of 12 megapixels at f2.8. The larger chip also results in lower noise per given ISO, and less need for noise reduction. In short, this is a pretty honest camera, aimed at people who understand cameras better.The majority of people who purchase an A810 and all its over-pixeled brethren don't have a clue, and this allows companies like Canon to market to them shamelessly. In optics you tend to get what you pay for. If you buy this camera knowing you are getting a usable 2 megapixel camera, then go for it. To the rest of the people out there, beware. Canon may slap a 16 megapixel sensor in the A810, but don't expect to take advantage of it.December 2013 update: My son is getting another camera as a gift, a Canon Powershot S120. It uses the same larger sensor as the G series Canons, but uses a much slower lens for telephoto shots, and lacks such niceties as a flash shoe, or a viewfinder. The up-side? It's a far more compact camera than the G series. Compared to the A series cameras, the S120 can take some advantage of the available 6 megapixel resolution setting (M1) at full telephoto. The extra chip size means it can use higher ISOs without the smearing and noise of the A series cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a basic camera thats easy to use and has the basic functions this is a great camera. The battery life is the big selling point for me. My other two cameras have more features but kill batteries faster than you can put them in. Seems to be pretty rugged. Great Buy!

Reviews.Title: It does need a memory card
Reviews.Author: Mac Buddha "aka deburr"
Reviews.Content: I don't know why, in all the descriptions of this camera that is does not include "Uses SDHC, not included." I had to go to the Canon web site to plow through the information to find that sort of necessary bit of information. Other than that, to me, very important bit of information, it is an excellent, tiny camera. It does everything I want to do with it, and does it quite simply. It's not a big, expensive, professional camera, but I didn't need one of those. Another thought in passing. It might not need to be said, but this is pretty much a right handed camera. A leftie can probably use it, but it might be a little awkward. Works fine for me

Reviews.Title: Good for its class
Reviews.Author: SherburneJA
Reviews.Content: For the price range and the type of use it is intended for, I'm perfectly happy with this camera. There are people that may disagree i'm sure, but as long as you're not expecting high dollar features from a low-medium range camera, you'll be happy with this.

Reviews.Title: I Really Like This "Autopilot" Digital
Reviews.Author: Daneen Petty
Reviews.Content: I'm a serious amateur photographer, so my go-to camera is a digital DSLR...but it's heavy and with prohibitive luggage prices these days, sometimes I'd rather not travel with it and risk its health.  For destinations involving family parties or where I'll likely take fun photos versus anything deeply artistic, I don't mind a simpler point and shoot.  The last one I bought I had high hopes for as my previous model with Sony was great.  It was terrible and I've never been happy with it.  I read reviews and took a chance on this one and am very, very happy.  If all you want to do is point and shoot a photo or video you'll LOVE it.  No "dialing" to video setting, just push the record button on the back and launch right into filming.  Now, if you want to be a little more artistic or have very high standards...I think you'll still like it a lot.  16 megapixels means great resolution.  It has a decent zoom feature and it's very easy to use (there is a 'question' button on the back, how much simpler can you get??)  There is a slight hesitation in some settings but you can find a setting that pretty much fires as soon as you push the button.  Likewise, there is quite a long hesitation using the flash as it is "charging the flash".  I can still get around that with a different setting.  There is an interesting setting that takes three photos in lightening-speed-succession and "marries" the best from each into one final photo--so if someone moves or blinks, you'll still get a good sharp shot.  That was pretty cool.  Since high resolution and a fast trigger are my biggest concerns, I'm happy with this.  It's not a DSLR, but I know that and don't hold that against it.  There are other reviews here that go into much greater depth (and I found them to be spot-on)---my unanswered question was about shutter speed and I find it adequate for what I use this camera for.  I'm not sorry at all that I took a chance on it.

Reviews.Title: A great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Gary Lentz
Reviews.Content: I started with the A710, used it for years, almost wore it out, and fell in love with it.So, when I decided to replace it, the A810 seemed like a logical choice.It is smaller, takes clearer pictures, has the same features as the A710.  I didn't have learn a whole new set of skills to use.The only thing I fault it on is the menu and how to make some of the settings.  It could be a little simpler in that department.Otherwise, this is one of the best little cameras in its price range.

Reviews.Title: Good Choice for the Money
Reviews.Author: Lisade
Reviews.Content: Good little camera for the money.  I wanted a small camera that I could easily replace the batteries while traveling.  This camera does that.  It takes a pretty good picture without the zoom feature.  It is what I expected and fits the bill for the purpose it was purchased.

Reviews.Title: Screen went bad in less than 4 months...
Reviews.Author: Justin B
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera in August and it seemed a decent camera for the price. At first my only complaint was the rather noisy zoom function, but now it's worthless junk. The camera turns on, but no screen image, which is not acceptable for a less than 6 month old camera.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: LMA
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera. I was worried about the size vs my slight shaking. With my last camera I sometimes had blurry pictures because of this. Well the PowerShoot A810 does a wonderful job stabilizing the image. I have had a dramatic reduction in blurriness.I have only used the auto mode but this works well for regular shots, zooms, and videos. The one thing I think would improve the product is enclosing a printed copy of the full operators manual as well as the Quick Start quide. I like using AA batteries as well. I recommend the camera for the casual user.

Reviews.Title: Good value for every day camera.
Reviews.Author: Stanley J. Hasegawa "Movie Nut"
Reviews.Content: I've taken it on my trip to Japan.  I have a video camera, but decided it's too much trouble to lug the beast around, so I used this lightweight camera to take my souvenir shots.  The quality is very good and I can slip it into my pants pocket.  The battery has lasted a long time and I haven't had to change it after 6 months of use.  It's my everyday camera, too, that I use around the house.  The price is reasonable.  The only bad part is that in bright daylight, I can't see the picture I'm taking on the screen because of the glare.  I have to turn away and go into picture viewing mode.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Andy Crandall
Reviews.Content: My camera was defective.  It was not working properly when I took it out of the box.  I tried to use it for one week.  I finally called Cannon for tech service.  They said I would need to send it in to the warranty center for repair.  I just received an email today.  They want $85.52 to repair a camera that I've had for about 4 weeks and paid $74.00 dollars for.  I am not happy with Cannon.  I have used Cannon cameras for 20 years.  This will probably be my last.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: A. Primatic
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a backup and bought it because it was a Canon and should be a good bet.  I was very disappointed with the results. Pictures were terribly out of focus and the color was yellowish.  I returned it for a refund. Perhaps it was damaged

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShop A810 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: NVH
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my father in law's 90th birthday as he was still taking pictures with a disposable 35 mm film camera. This camera is a fairly straight forward camera - point and shoot- which is what I wanted for him. ONLY issue so far is that it is quite small and very smooth making it difficult for him to not drop while pushing the button. I'm going to try some strategically placed velcro or something similar to aid in his ability to hang onto the camera.The seller was prompt with delivery. The box was a bit tattered and I did not get the feeling that this was a "factory new" item although I had understood that I was ordering "new". It looked like everthing that should be there was there, just not boxed and wrapped like a brand new camera. I had put in batteries and a memory card before wrapping the camera so my father-in-law was none the wiser as to whether or not it was a brand new camera otherwise I would have questioned if it was new or would have just returned it.

Reviews.Title: Aweome camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Marquis S. "Ace"
Reviews.Content: I give this 5/5 rating, its an amazing camera, and can record in 720p which is pretty good for a point & shootThis camera takes amazing photos, and I've al ready filmed a couple action scenes with this baby!the pictures are cristal clear and so is the footage when recorded!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Knox
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift. From what i've heard, she is crazy about it and takes it everywhere with her.

Reviews.Title: Powershot A810
Reviews.Author: Karen Magee
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photo buff....so this camera is perfect for me! It takes nice photos and isn't complicated to operate. I haven't had for too long, so I'm hoping it will give me good service for a long time!

Reviews.Title: works well,looks great.
Reviews.Author: Gerald Weinstein "Gypsy,s Dad"
Reviews.Content: this product works very well, only problems I have instruction manual is terrible, I have been taking pictures for over 50 years, this is a wonderful camera, does a beautiful job, well made, I love photos it produces, and is very good looking.

Reviews.Title: Amazed at how much it can do to optimize the picture under a variety of conditions.
Reviews.Author: Albert Dandrea
Reviews.Content: This Canon replaced my 5 year old Nikon Coolplex and I was amazed at how much more stable it is for my aging hands. It also seems to be able to do much more automatic adjustments to get the best picture under adverse lighting conditions. A terrific buy.

Reviews.Title: product
Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: this camera is great. it came on time, with everything that was supposed to come with it. this was purchased for christmas for a gift for my aunt. she has wanted a digital camera for awhile. its not too complex and should be very easy for her to use

Reviews.Title: a disappointing gift
Reviews.Author: saralynn17
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift and was hopeful that it would be an easy point and shoot like previous cameras I had.  We had owned one of the very first Canon digital point-and-shoots and it's still plugging away - much better than this one.  Very disappointing.  It hesitates a lot before it will take a picture (I think that's partly the "Auto" mode that's analyzing what kind of photo/lighting it is?)  The different settings are very hard to find. For example, to find the auto-timer is not very intuitive, and so I missed a couple of family photos there.  I'm on my 3rd set of batteries and have only taken a about a 100 pictures.  When I have tried to use it at family gatherings, I pick it up, aim it, press, ....and NOTHING!  It refuses to take the picture!  Very embarrassing!  I will be replacing this very soon.  I would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert Schmitt
Reviews.Content: I started with the A580, used it for years, shutter failed, then went on to an A590 model.It is smaller, takes clearer pictures, has similar features to the A590, in a smaller package.I didn't have to learn a whole new set of skills to use.  The only drawback is there's no viewfinder.The A810 LCD screen is harder to see in bright sunlight.  Other than that, a really good camera.It has a decent zoom feature and it's very easy to use (there is a 'question' button on the back, how much simpler can you get??) There is a slight hesitation in some settings but you can find a setting that pretty much fires as soon as you push the button.The camera powers up quickly. The menu system is easy to access, you put the camera in "Live" mode and you can access all the special shooting modes by repeatedly pressing the thumb dial. In "Auto" mode the camera chooses the mode for you. I found "Auto" mode adequate to most of my needs except when taking pictures of people, then I prefer the "Portrait" mode. Recording movies is simple, just push the red button. I have not used the movie mode extensively. The zoom lever is around the shutter release where I prefer it. I'd say I'm pleased overall with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera except for 1 small gripe
Reviews.Author: MikeRock
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon A460 for a few years that took great pictures until one day it bit the dust, so I looked into this camera. So far its been great, however I like taking widescreen shots, and while I was able to do this with the A460 in different resolutions to save filespace, you only have 1 option on the A810, and that is close to 3 MB,so a regular SD card will not hold too many pictures, so I had to get an 8GB SDHC card.Other than that, its been a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Good features, poor sensor
Reviews.Content: The features of this camera are many. Some of which are very nice/fun to mess with. It is all spoiled by a very poor quality image sensor. All the photos appear grainy as if they were taken in low light scenarios, even in broad daylight.For instance. Using a tripod at ISO 200 in broad daylight I took a photo of a friend who was wearing a black t-shirt. Within the dark area's of the photo (the black t-shirt) you could see intense grain, and no the shirt was not dirty.Overall the image quality is not that far from what a cel-phone is capable of. So you might not want to waste your money on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries!
Reviews.Author: D. E. Denman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my stolen Canon Elph. I don't think the pictures are quite as nice, and you will need batteries after about 20 shots with flash. Actually have this up for sale, and have already replaced with a rechargeable Canon product. However, this would be an inexpensive camera for a child, who would take more shots in the day.

Reviews.Title: Birthday Gift!
Reviews.Author: Jann Farnsworth
Reviews.Content: Bought this after reviewing Consumer Reports!  The price was in my range and very easy to use!  Would recommend for first time young camera user.

Reviews.Title: Great find
Reviews.Author: Shahara
Reviews.Content: Low cost, great deal. just buy rechargable batteris though it will not work without them. it works great for filming and taking pictures. small and easy to put in purse, car, bookbag etc.

Reviews.Title: very good product easy-to-use
Reviews.Author: Joseph Savona
Reviews.Content: I have not purchased a camera for 30 years, I love the new features in this camera easy to use the chip fits my computer and TV love it

Reviews.Title: A great camera/I love that it uses AA batteries
Reviews.Author: june
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I use it almost daily.  It uses AA batteries, which makes it great.  Pictures turn out wonderful.  It's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Steve Zander
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my son and daughter in law. It works great! Small enough to drop in a pocket but takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Ok camera
Reviews.Author: C. Miller
Reviews.Content: I found this a little complicated for me after replacing my Kodak Easy Share when it died.  I would buy a cheaper camera next time myself but it would be fine if you like lots of options for picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Compact and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Steven S Luongo
Reviews.Content: Real nice picture quality. Fast recovery to take multiple pictures. Easy to delete unwanted pictures. Quick and easy to download.

Reviews.Title: Love my New Camera
Reviews.Author: Norma Markovics
Reviews.Content: Love the ease of using this camera...takes great pictures and easy to use....love the color and its so light..fits in my small handbag...love it!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: A. L. Peagler
Reviews.Content: This camera is a good starter camera for someone who is not into professional photography and simply wants point and shoot action. Its large LCD display makes it simple to view subjects and the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: A Canon
Reviews.Author: Shane j McNair
Reviews.Content: Canon is just a good quality camera you can depend on. I also have a EOS 1D Mark II professional outfit.

Reviews.Title: good for general "snapshots"
Reviews.Author: Kalhoon58
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the performance of this camera, it does not make sense to to incorporate a 16 megapixel rating to such a bottom of the line camera, "only as good as its weekest link" as they say, the lens on this does not do the high megapixel rating on this camera justice, the pictures were ok, maybe for low to medium quality disneyland shots...

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Citi "Gramma Jo"
Reviews.Content: Love the camera and all the opts that came with it!!!! It is great buty for the money!!! The warnatee with it made it the best buy yet!!!

Reviews.Title: Good little camer
Reviews.Author: A Reader
Reviews.Content: This camera has been ok.  I really liked my fuji point and shoot better.  This one uses a lot of memory as my memory card gets full after one video and about 10 pics, where with my fuji it held about 150 pics.  It also tends to take blurry pictures.  When I finally get a good picture, the quality is nice.  So it will do for now.

Reviews.Title: Nice & easy
Reviews.Author: Donna Rinda
Reviews.Content: Flash takes a bit long to recharge between pictures.  Thus, you cannot take pictures too close together.  Still am not

Reviews.Title: not bad, but its not great
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: for the price its not bad. there is a delay in between the time you press the picture and when it takes it, maybe like 1.5 seconds, but it usually means you miss the shot unless you are dealing with things that dont move

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and price is low then new.
Reviews.Author: Elena T.
Reviews.Content: It is better then have a new. Price was low. I got for my friend as a gift. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A810 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 5x Digital Image
Reviews.Author: felrodrios
Reviews.Content: Very good Camera, for all around use. You can carry it in your pocket, so that when the time comes, of taking that picture. Your camera is ready if you are. Don't miss out on those special moments, in your life that you would like to freeze, by taking to photo of it. It's a compact Digital Camera with a 16.0 MP with 5x Digital zoom image. Great for all family gathering, parties, special occasions. The price is just right, will not make a hole in your pockets. Great Gift!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: mjwacker
Reviews.Content: Better than my $300 Olympus, it's fast, clear, small, and it only takes 2 aa batteries, I just love it.

Reviews.Author: holly
Reviews.Content: Have to keep chaging the batteries constanntly.  I dont know whats going on with it.  I'm hoping that it works soon.

Reviews.Title: its a good camera
Reviews.Author: Rafael Frias
Reviews.Content: Its a good camera, the only problem the battery are AAA and not a charger type, but the rest good camera

Reviews.Title: A good minimalistic camera that works.
Reviews.Author: Anin
Reviews.Content: Just what I was looking for.  A good point & shoot camera using common AA batteries.  I've returned Kodak camera I bought few days earlier after getting this one for only $20 more.  The difference in picture quality was just too obvious.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: happy
Reviews.Content: good camera. especially for the price.  small and light, fits in a pocket easily.  love that it uses AA batteries instead of one I need to charge.  fun lens options like fishtank and fuzzy edges for play.  I'm not anywhere near a professional photographer, but I like to take photos and for more serious picture-taking I have a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: chuck81
Reviews.Content: Great camera, no complaints, now the wife has her own camera to use. Take your own pictures! No more asking me to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: kid likes it. That is all that matters
Reviews.Author: Gunnar Nettleship
Reviews.Content: My kid likes it. That is all that matters. My opinion: it is plastic and seems like it may fall apart, but only time will tell on that one. I like the fact that it runs on regular AA batteries, so I can toss in my rechargeable as needed. Aside from that, it seems good.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Ms. Martha A. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it a lot yet but I like everything about it so far. With the holidays coming up, it will get a work out.

Reviews.Title: Camera purchase
Reviews.Author: Kathy Bobb
Reviews.Content: I use these cameras and they are perfect for our work, but the cover to the batteries was broken on it, so we have to use tape to keep it shut.  Not a very professional look, wish it hadn't been broken.. But can't afford to get another one right now.

Reviews.Author: John Mackay
Reviews.Content: Just missing the manual mode and loving the AA batteries. I'm using rechargeables, but in case anyone forgets to recharge normal alkalines do the job.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: j c
Reviews.Content: the camera is easy to use and takes very good photos. very light to carry in pocket or carry in purse

Reviews.Title: everything I expected
Reviews.Author: edward st onge
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for an older Kodak. I had a big vacation coming up and this camera had everything I was looking for.AA batteries and the price were the deciding factors.It takes excellent pictures in AUTO mode,even while riding on top of a double decker bus.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Lori Dostourian "Lori"
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for the money. The picture has great quality and it fits in my purse--small and compact. I like this camera with the stabilizer and rich color with 16 MP, much better than my 5MP. This is hold old my camera was, so I needed a durable dependable small camera and this fits the requirements.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Cristine
Reviews.Content: In the last couple of years, I have purchased a Nikon Sureshot and a Kodak share - both of which turned out to be very disappointing.  This one is so easy, it's basically self-explanatory.  I think this is going to be a great little camera and the lower price just makes it that much better!

Reviews.Title: Makes taking great photos a breeze!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl A. Jarvis
Reviews.Content: Impressive! It is so intuitive that I no longer have to set it to macro manually and a lot of other steps that makes this a huge step up from my last Canon. This was a great buy! Great product!

Reviews.Title: Camera OK for the price.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Camera works well but I have some problems with savings images on SD card, often is not recording and shows error. I have tried different card and did not help.

Reviews.Title: Get The Picture
Reviews.Author: Birdie Gee
Reviews.Content: I have a Blog and needed clear pictures quickly and dependably, that I can adjust and work with. I'm not into fancy, smancy, loaded with features type cameras.  I love this one, it works great and I can adjust the pictures on my computer to post later. I keep finding more small features on it. The zoom, lens directional capabilities and video features are terrific too! All this and reasonable too... Birdie Gee

Reviews.Title: Reasonable for the price
Reviews.Author: Carlos Bertera
Reviews.Content: Fine point and shoot camera. Mediocre results with low light. Common AA batteries, good flash, easy to handle, simple controls.

Reviews.Title: Yippee I got a little camera!
Reviews.Author: Carol A Gronli
Reviews.Content: This is just what I wanted.  I'm not a professional photographer so I didn't want a camera with extra lens etc.  This lil guy takes pix exactly as I expect him to.  Since I have software to editorialize my photos I am quite happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: excelent product
Reviews.Author: Victor Hugo Mora
Reviews.Content: The product is excellent and quality expected. I recommend your purchase and I appreciate the opportunity to acquire it. thanks

Reviews.Title: This Camera is slow - Esta Camara es lenta para tomar fotos
Reviews.Author: matosrafael
Reviews.Content: Esta Camara es lenta para tomar fotos . Se necesita mucho tiempo para estar listo para la siguiente fotografía sobre todo cuando usa flash. Esto hace que la fotografía de acción es casi imposible de tomarla. por lo momento las otras funciones no me ha dado problema.This Camera is slow. It takes a long time to get ready for the next picture especially when using flash. This makes action photography is almost impossible to take it. so far the other functions has not given me trouble.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Lynn Smith
Reviews.Content: I received my camera and have used it without any trouble, it's a nice camera that will fit comfortably in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: James O. Gilbert
Reviews.Content: It has a number of settings I had to get used to but overall it's a great little camera for a novice.This camera is 16 mega pixels and my older Cannon A560 only has 7.1 mega pixels that's themain reason I bought it. But overall I like it but I probably didn't need it, so my wife says.

Reviews.Title: A great starter
Reviews.Author: Charlie L Haas
Reviews.Content: Its a 5, simple and easy to use. For a pack along camera its handy. Has easy to follow instructions for all, takes about 15min to learn and you are on your way to great shoots. Get out and have fun.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Carla Bain-Sealey
Reviews.Content: Purchased based on photo when it arrived was disappointed as it was just an ordinary camera.  Previously had an inexpensive Casio camera this is basically the same.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot Nice Gift for Daughter
Reviews.Author: sisterskitchen
Reviews.Content: We purchased this Cannon PowerShot A810 for my daughter's birthday last year. It will be a year next month and she loves it. It does everything she needs it to. Even her teenage sons like it. We would give it as a gift again.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: Marcos Carpio
Reviews.Content: the camera works very good, I am very happy with this. Is perfect for travels and home pictures and more

Reviews.Title: Great first camera
Reviews.Author: S. Leslie "Kevin's Mom"
Reviews.Content: Got this for my 5 year old son so he could have his own camera instead of grabbing mine.  I already had to have my camera worked on once because he was rough on it.  He obviously had an interest in taking pictures and his "kids" camera just wasn't cutting it with him.  He wanted a "big kid" version.  The pricing allowed me to get something that would serve his curiosity and the features allow it to serve as my backup camera.  Because the right side has the extended curve, it is easy for him to hold.  I like that it used AA batteries so that I don't have to spend a lot on a proprietary one.  The quality has been fine.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A810 Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Mary S. Lippard
Reviews.Content: So far it's great. It is a handy little thing and I love taking pictures with it. All I have to do is point and shoot most of the time.  It is really great for those times when you  want a camera and don't want to lug around a big old whopper of one and all the attachments.  i would order again when the need arises. I think I would look for one that was waterproof next time. But this one is great. If you are looking for a great little camera this is it.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Bar Con
Reviews.Content: I have not had this camera for long, but so far it has been fairly easy to learn its operational procedures and it takes good quality pictures. My only concern for the future is the durability of the black hard rubber cover on the Audio/video Output Digital Terminal. This covers the place where you plug in the cable to download pictures to the computer. I fear it may break off after any amount of use and I doubt it could be replaced. I hope I am wrong. Perhaps Canon might address that.

Reviews.Title: very nice choice
Reviews.Author: Madhumama
Reviews.Content: best price,best pictures and best results.easy to operate.the vdo is also very easy to take.and vdo resolution is great.no problem whatsoever...!!!i am satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Like it allot.
Reviews.Author: James Simmonds
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for the same camera I broke on a trip. Easy to use, compact, and good quality pics.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot A810 16.0 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Anita John
Reviews.Content: It is tiny but the screen is as big as the camera.It really does have a nice shake system, if shake a bit or take a picture driving 60 mph it adjusts for that without blur.Love the price for what I got.The only hard thing was the install CD did not work for some reason. I had to download the software and the driver for it. That took some time and I had to have tech support from Cannon help on-line. It all worked out though.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Little camera
Reviews.Author: Marciel
Reviews.Content: Shoots great pictures, video.  I have had it for about 2 weeks and it has out done my expectations, I am a very happy novice photographer!!

Reviews.Title: Great point and shut camera
Reviews.Author: Udochukwu Nwachukwu
Reviews.Content: Just the right size. it is not bulky even with the AA baterries. Works very well. I had it for a week. it took great graduation fotos. Still trying to learn how to switch back and forthfrom video to still shots. Will recommend for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Gordon Ringelstetter
Reviews.Content: We use several of the compact cameras where i work, This one is great. Low priced  and uses AA batteries so you can do a quick change and keep on working in the field.. That is important to us rather than have to stop for low battery go back and charge the unit like so many cameras are now.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight and easy to use
Reviews.Author: as above
Reviews.Content: Red colour means its easy to find in one's bag! It is user friendly:)For the price, we are well satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Basic digital camera
Reviews.Author: Stormy1
Reviews.Content: I recently ordered this Canon PowerShot A810 digital camera to replace and older Fuji digital camera that finally died on me. This new Canon digital camera is comparable to the Fuji camera I had for the most part. The optical zoom is 5X with both cameras and picture quality is about the same between the Canon and Fuji cameras....but the Canon camera is a little slower to take photos, especially when using the flash. This Canon A810 camera is fairly easy to use and takes fairly good photos meant for general purpose photos. I take a lot of scenic photos with this camera and it does a fairly decent job with those photos. This camera uses the common SD or SDHC cards and that's a huge plus! Also, this camera uses 2 "AA" batteries, another nice plus. I can take maybe several hundred photos with no flash on a pair of "AA" batteries and maybe 60 photos using a lot of flash on a set of "AA" batteries. The video is fair with this camera, but I do not take many videos with a basic digital camera, unless it's an emgergency. Overall, this is a fine basic digital camera and takes a decent photo meant for family or general photography and rather compact size makes it easier to stow it in your pocket also!

Reviews.Title: Photos great - battery hog
Reviews.Author: Janice Jerdee
Reviews.Content: After initial struggles - it takes great photos - however seems to be a real battery HOG.  Needs new batteries after about 40 photos -  Will be sure to keep additional batteries in the case.

Reviews.Title: Easy point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Sandie
Reviews.Content: Good quality pictures for the price. For use at local stores for incident and event pictures. With image stabilization, anyone can take pictures that are not blurry. The macro mode helps with getting small details. And the zoom means we don't have to get right in front of something to get a picture of it. Not used every day, so keeping a battery charged would have been hard to do, so the convenience of using normal batteries was really a necessity.. Exactly what we needed.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Kitt Richardson
Reviews.Content: the viewing screen is amazing! The picture clarity is very good! This product is very user friendly. I bought this for my Grandfather!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A810 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 5x Digital Image
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's very easy to use, stays charged longer than most. I have the GE camera and I no longer use it after purchasing this one. My son also uses this to record videos and always wants to use it. This is a really good camera for the price. Takes great pictures and clearer than my other one. Wish I would have seen this one first before I purchased the ge. Great camera here! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great  little camera.
Reviews.Author: Brit in the USA
Reviews.Content: My wife uses the camera every week at her school and loves the size and quickness at taking pictures. It is just thrown into here bag with out a problem.

Reviews.Title: good for price
Reviews.Author: G. Lucid "reader"
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product to anyone who loses/breaks their camera frequently, and/or forgets to charge the battery!This is good price for a very good quality camera, and you just use AA batteries

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael W Buehler
Reviews.Content: Takes AA batteries.The flash takes a little while to charge and trigger, so holding still before taking the picture is important.For the price it is a very excellent camera.Quality and zoom are both acceptable.You do need to buy a memory card for this camera. (We are using a 4 gig at the moment, and it still holds quite a few pictures)Overall for the price we have zero complaints. It's just hard to get a decent camera for this price.5 stars

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Mark Ward
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for the $.  Takes very good pictures. Some older computers may not recognize it.  Newer ones all seem to.

Reviews.Title: Slow camera
Reviews.Author: John L. Young
Reviews.Content: I have had a bunch of digital cameras. This one was so slow. It takes such a long time to be ready for the next picture. This makes action photography all but impossible. I would not recommend this even at the reduced price.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Johns
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter for christmas. She just had a baby in november and loves the camera and lives how the pictures come out.

Reviews.Title: Okay for First Time Camera
Reviews.Author: RAM
Reviews.Content: The picture and the video quality was not as good as others said it was.  Good starter camera for a kid, but I wouldn't give this to someone who has owned a camera previously.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera!
Reviews.Author: randy
Reviews.Content: Far better than I was expecting for picture quality...can't beat the value! Slim & small, fits in shirt pocket...good video too. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: A perfectly handy P&S; that takes impressive photos!
Reviews.Author: A. Anderson "algoan"
Reviews.Content: I had a much larger Sony camera that I had come to rely on, but it was just too bulky to carry around for day-to-day photo opportunities.  I did quite a bit of research and decided on the Canon PowerShot A810 -- the reviews were good and the price was GREAT.  I have been extremely pleased with the quality I have been able to get from such a small camera!  I generally have it set to "auto" so it will determine the settings based on the subject, and with few exceptions, I haven't been disappointed (still learning how to capture photos of our VERY hyper dogs LOL -- but I just revert back to the Sony for those shots).  I have been using this camera for a little over a month and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: Jack K
Reviews.Content: After using a SLR camera for many, many years, tis is so easy to carry and use.  It is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: Time between pictures is well over a second.
Reviews.Author: Annette R. Miller
Reviews.Content: This review by Stan.  I like the small size, I especially like it uses rechargeable AA batteries, and the picture quality is just fine by me.  Very nice little point and shoot with macro, a flash, some zoom (telephoto)  and video.  This is a good hiking camera.  I keep mine in a baggie to keep the dust and water out.My problem is that it will not take even 2 pictures as fast as you can click the button, there is a very annoying time span between when you can take a second, third and fourth picture.  It is LONG, I just counted 2 seconds between subsequent shots.  I don’t know if it is the camera, or the memory card I bought to put in it, a SanDisk 8GB SD High Capacity Card (SDSDB-008G-B35).  Less annoying is that the video, while good, is the MOV or QuickTime format by Apple.  Which means you have to download yet another program to your Windows computer.Also, the only way to record your voice is to use the video, you can't voice comment to a picture, like the Fuji camera I last had.  Also annoying, is that this camera will not work at all without a separately purchased memory card.  If you buy this camera, and I would recommend it, buy a memory card at the same time.The written manual is bad, but the camera is simple to figure out. I did not download the manual to my computer, or any other programs that came with it.  It tries to sucker you in by telling you the downloadable manual it tells you how to erase all videos and images at once, instead of individually like the written manual says.  Here's how.  With the camera on or off, and looking at the viewfinder side, press the bottom button on the left… the square with the little arrow in it; then press the MENU button next to it, then press DISP to highlight Erase All, hit the center button and now it hopefully it is obvious .

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Vicky
Reviews.Content: Our grandson was looking for a camera. He's 11 yrs old and this is a great starter camera for him. It takes great pictures & video. He is very pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: pocket-sized and convenient
Reviews.Author: Catherine E. Macleod
Reviews.Content: it has more features than are immediately apparent.  The auto-focus has been hit-or-miss for me.  it fits in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Its a good deal
Reviews.Author: BooBoo "BooBoo"
Reviews.Content: Takes very nice pictures. I like the AA battery setup.What I dont like is the zoom function around the shutter button,I inadvertently hit that a lot.Otherwise Im still quite pleased with product,big bang for the buck for novices like me.

Reviews.Title: Arrived in a timely manner just wasn't as complete as I thought it would be.
Reviews.Author: Wanda Vacha
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my grandson and it arrived without without a chip so they still haven't used the camera.  I sent one through the U.S. postal system.  I have bought camera's much cheaper and they always had a chip in them.  I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: as expected
Reviews.Author: Raymond
Reviews.Content: good camera. Met my expectations completely.  No complaints about the camera. a a a a a a a a a

Reviews.Title: Nice casual camera
Reviews.Author: Zhenn
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photographer, nor do I know a lot about cameras. Canon seems to have a great reputation overall, and this was for my 14 year old daughter. She enjoys taking pictures, and with the addition of an SD card, she was good to go. She really likes it. Its a simple point and shoot kind of thing with some extra options. It has more resolution than we need, and she can grab batteries anywhere if she needs them. Good combo.First one we received seemed to have an issue in the lens. A chunk of plastic came off the inside and got stuck to the interior of it. Returned it to Amazon and they sent us another one very quickly. No matter what you buy, there's an occasional bad one, so I'm just chalking it up to that. Replacement camera has been great and with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A810
Reviews.Author: Boo Boo
Reviews.Content: Very easy to setup and use. I like the quality of the photos as well as the quality of the video.

Reviews.Title: Great camera... great price
Reviews.Author: Stephen Lloyd
Reviews.Content: My old Canon died after 8 years. I'm used to a point and shoot that took alkaline batteries, and don't have a cell phone. This is great for me. I didn't need the 16 gig card, but for 12 bucks..go for it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Hill
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much! It takes excellent pictures, it will be a great help on our vacation! Wonderful product for the average Joe!

Reviews.Title: So far it is working great
Reviews.Author: Wadi Torres
Reviews.Content: I love the size of this camara, I have a Canon power shot S5 IS and I love it but sometimes it is too bulky to carry around and I decided to get this for when I don't want to carry the larger camera and this is great and works like a charm. I have only had it for 2-3 weeks but I love it.

Reviews.Title: Mom was excited and pleased!
Reviews.Author: Shae Godbey
Reviews.Content: The viewing screen is a little fuzzy when taking the picture but after you take the picture it's clear. It's takes great pictures and really easy to use. This was my moms first pocket camera and she was very excited and very pleased. She doesn't like a lot of technical issues when it comes to cameras, and this one was just right. Thinking about purchasing the printer for it next time.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A810
Reviews.Author: Judy Effrige Avery
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Easy to use and easy to push buttons. Great zoom for far away pictures. Just miss the booklets they used to include with the cameras instead of everything being online.

Reviews.Title: super camera
Reviews.Author: Whitey
Reviews.Content: this is a very well made camera. little slow on recharging the flash .overall great performance and takes great pics.

Reviews.Title: small yet mighty
Reviews.Author: Madeline L Hamel
Reviews.Content: It's a keeper but I did have to order a memory card.  Fits nicely in my handbag.  Glad I ordered it.

Reviews.Title: Great, easy to use, camera for Grandma!
Reviews.Author: Sausage321
Reviews.Content: Plenty of technology that works great as a simple point and shoot for the technologically challenged.  Red makes it harder to loose too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for point and shoot
Reviews.Author: A. Surma
Reviews.Content: We bought these for our kids to use on vacations and around the yard and they are working great.  The key point for us was that they run on AA batteries so we can keep a set of rechargeable AAs going at all times.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: debby
Reviews.Content: The Powershot is a great compact camera that takes excellent photos.  I don't think I will have to edit my photos any more since my pictures are brighten and sharper than ever.  I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: great little camera!
Reviews.Author: lenard
Reviews.Content: so easy to use! takes great pics~good enough that i entered a photo contest and was a finalist! i really recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Mediocre.....
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Galloway
Reviews.Content: Biggest gripe about this camera is that it has no viewfinder other than the lcd screen on the back - makes it impossible to aim the camera outdoors in any sunlight at all. takes ok pictures indoors with no flash - WAY too much light reflection with the flash on - never use it. Also, if it has a procedure to adjust the photo resolution down to a smaller size, I can't find it. Too involved of a process to turn on/off the date stamp. Previous Canon P/S died, needed another quickly. A810 was cheap, got what I paid for. Will pay more next time. Caveat Emptor.......

Reviews.Title: Worthless product
Reviews.Author: Robert L Hoecker
Reviews.Content: I can't honestly rate this product because iit never worked.  I returned it to Amazon for a full refund.  I then bought a Nikon camera locally.  I have no complaint with Amazon's service; however, I would have to give the Canon PowerShot A810 one star and that's generous.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with a small footprint
Reviews.Author: pabloarnoldo
Reviews.Content: I swear by Canon cameras. This is my 5th.  I purchased this as a glove compartment camera, since I don't want to carry my T3 DSLR with me all the time and leave it in the car.  This isn't much larger than a pack of cigarettes and takes great pictures if there is adequate lighting.  I am also very pleased with the video quality.  I cannot attest to low light shooting as I have not tried that yet.  You won't be disappointed with this camera!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: kennie
Reviews.Content: Best little camera for that kind of money.I do recommend it to anyone who is looking at having a good camera for little money.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Lewis20813
Reviews.Content: Good price vs. quality balance.  Bought for basic point and shoot photography.  Camera has more features than I will ever use.  Canon makes a good product in general.  Like the ease of 'AA' batteries.  Picture quality is as expected.  Nice basic camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: elaine rizan
Reviews.Content: great camera does whatever i need  i plan to take phtos for the internet with this camera colour is good

Reviews.Title: Great point and Shoot!
Reviews.Author: lola
Reviews.Content: Bought this because I needed a good point and shoot camera that I can use every other day.  Works great and I didn't have to read a lot of instructions first.  I'm going to put a FOFA key finder on this one since I always misplace it.  YES, this is a double review.  How can anyone live without FOFAs?

Reviews.Title: PowerShot no so powerful
Reviews.Author: Just Human
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace my PowerShot A40 which I was very happy with years, but thought it was time to crack open the dinosaur egg.  This is a small camera.  Almost too small for me to get a nice grip.  The pictures don't portray well on the screen, I felt as though I was getting lousy shots.  Once I uploaded the pix they looked better, picking up more detail that I would have thought, but not quite 16 MP worthy.  For the price it's a good take along camera; it fits in a small purse easily, shirt pocket etc.  The start up time is good, but the zoom isn't all it's cracked up to be.  It records up to 30 minutes.  My smartphone has a 5.0 MP camera and sorry to say it takes better quality shots and there is no time limit on the recording.  As a first camera for a youngster or just to have something always at hand, it was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "gone to the dogs"
Reviews.Content: bought for use at work, does a nice job, easy to use and pictures are crisp & clean.  Low price and good pictures ... how can you go wrong????

Reviews.Title: This was a gift
Reviews.Author: William H. Ruff "William H. Ruff"
Reviews.Content: I was concerned because the camera did not have an independant view finder. I thought the camera would be hard to use. The recipient loves the camera and takes it everywhere she goes.

Reviews.Title: Cheap price, great camera
Reviews.Author: Djorgz26
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera for a very low price. On review mode the picture doesn't seem to be sharp but it's outstanding once the shot is taken.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: agom
Reviews.Content: I really love this product.Hope to get it more for my friends. It tok nice pictures. Nice camera with good feautures

Reviews.Title: get what you pay for....
Reviews.Author: B. Lee "stuffamnca"
Reviews.Content: just a little backup camera....or for starting out  not bad for price but no where the quality of the next level cameras

Reviews.Title: very nice gift for mom
Reviews.Author: Gerald D. Inge
Reviews.Content: Great gift for Mother s day. It was in perfect condition and even came a day early. My Mom loves it and so excited that it will even shoot movies..... videos. Mom is 78 and the first thing I saw was the SCN mode and I new this would be a perfect fit.

Reviews.Title: disappointed product
Reviews.Author: particle
Reviews.Content: The body is plastic and feels uncomfortable. The picture is also not so clear and sometimes blurred. So I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Bad Zoom Switch.
Reviews.Author: Floyd Welch
Reviews.Content: Had it a week and the zoom switch wouldn't work. I kept getting a lens error every time I tried to zoom in on something. Returned it. It was pretty easy to return and get refund however. Thanks for that Amazon!

Reviews.Title: killed 2 cameras in <15 months
Reviews.Author: Mailliw Sugna
Reviews.Content: This camera does not have a rechargeable battery that recharges thru the USB. It uses 2 AA batteries. I have taken less than 100 pictures and it is on its second set.I have very poor luck with digital cameras and this one is no different.I dont like the funtion of it either.edit: I switched to lithium batteries and was much happier, but the first one died 10 months out then the replacement died in 4 months.I have not found a sub $100 camera that lasts. :(

Reviews.Title: Good pictures, but...
Reviews.Author: Marcela
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very nice pictures... the 16MP makes images with very good quality... However in the night I really Don't like the pics because didn't show a good quality. Maybe I have to configure it better and try it again.

Reviews.Title: Good product.
Reviews.Author: Richarda
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my little brother. No complaints so far. He loves it and uses it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera.
Reviews.Author: UNhappy
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera.  Seriously?  Your review must be a minimum number of words, or they won't accept it?  Sheesh.

Reviews.Title: gift
Reviews.Author: Kristina Beckett "teach"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my niece, she is so in love with this camera. We are a canon camera family and this one is great.

Reviews.Title: Battery life is disappointing.
Reviews.Author: Jeff Thomas
Reviews.Content: Camera has nice features and most of the ones I like but that it uses AA bateries is a let down. Much worse is that the batteries die down pretty quickly. I think I may have taken about 100 pictures and I've already had to replace the batteries. I'm thinking about re-gifting and buying a better camera. The price was great and now I know why.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, but ok
Reviews.Author: GAL
Reviews.Content: Sent this with my son to London on his school trip.  Didn't want to send an expensive camera just in case.  It survived and it took good pictures, BUT, the mechanisms sound and operate cheap.  It does not have that smooth click or shutter operation that more expensive cameras have, which bothers me to use it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen Herring
Reviews.Content: Camera takes good pictures but there are some many features and small buttons that it is sometimes hard to understand and operate for my 81-year old mother.

Reviews.Title: Not great Canon quality
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Poor quality images from a Canon. Slow response time. Would def have to go to a more expensive one if I wanted another point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: Think about this....
Reviews.Author: David August "Internet gadfly"
Reviews.Content: I've tried to post this twice already. Not surprisingly, Amazon declines to post the review. Here's the text I've tried to post, now redacted twice:"As of 11/22/2012, this camera is available on Amazon with free shipping for $85.99, and also available from O----e D---t (dot) com with free shipping for $69.99. I like Amazon as much as you do. But fifteen bucks is fifteen bucks. I'm buying it as a holiday gift. But I'm not buying it on Amazon."Twice, Amazon has described this review as not meeting their review guidelines. What praytell is the problem? Hmm?I selected this Canon Powershot as a holiday gift for its wide-angle lens and its image stabilization. The price (elsewhere) was also very attractive. I'm sure hoping my brother-in-law enjoys the camera.

Reviews.Title: Very poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Jeff F
Reviews.Content: I selected this camera based on my previous Canon Powershot A1000IS and the need for a camera that takes "AA" batteries.The photo quality of the camera was very poor and was even evident on the camera screen. When I transferred the image to the computer I had the same results. The image at full size was not crisp and when I magnified it just once, it showed very pixelated. I realize that this is the low end camera, but the image quality was around the same as my 1.3MP camera from 10 years ago. I returned this camera and purchased the Canon PowerShot A1300. I also go the same results from that camera and returned it also. I then purchased a Nikon CoolPix L26 that I am happy with except the boot time.

Reviews.Title: update -very light low contrast shots  in "auto"
Reviews.Author: TJR -Colorado
Reviews.Content: 4/4/13update-changed rating to 4, as it seems my camera came with non factory default settings after calling canon, we reset it it ,and now it takes very good pics, all light, and conditions.  quite happy for a inexpensive camera.  the new zoombrowswer s/w  is still not good-----------T-- been using this for about a week now,all i get out of it is blasted light shots, it has alot of adjustments. but the menuing system takes some getting used toif there is any light from windows , or background light it washed out everything, in auto, and IS.  might be sending this backunless i find the majic bullet ,  currently disappointing .one update -- the the zoombrowser version ( new one ) that comes with it has been modified it has a limit on the number of pictures it can deal withwhich is small.(in the mid hundreds)  400 i think)  gotta wonder what those sw dingbats were thinking.  an 8G SD card can hold thousands of photo mid resso basically this s/w is basically useless. its also FCS ver 1.0  Really?  Come on who ships beta s/w with anything to the public ,  sad..furthermore if you use a previous version (which does not have a limit( at least not one ive hit yet) from my big canon it doesnt work with this camera  doesnt recognize itWTH ? half the reason i buy ANY product from "certain" manufacturers is because they keep everything interoperable.  clearly this is a departure from that and i will voice mydissatisfaction with Canon on that point.

Reviews.Title: Cannot be used out of the box!
Reviews.Author: J. Driessen "JD"
Reviews.Content: This product is designed for, and marketed to, the general public.  As such, I would expect it to work out of the box.  Unfortunately, they do not include an SD card with it (which is not mentioned in the description) and instead include two AA batteries.  Honestly, why package a camera with two AA batteries which a customer is likely to have at home instead of the memory card they need to make it work?Also, the pictures default to 3456 x 4608.  I realize some people need pictures that huge, but the target market for this camera is most likely just taking snapshots. A default of half that would be more than enough and would certainly save them room on whatever cheapo memory card they are likely to find until they can get to an electronics store.

ProductInfo.Features:
16 effective megapixel, 1/2.3-inch CCD sensor
2.7-inch TFT color LCD with wide-viewing angle
DIGIC 4 image processor
720p HD video with dedicated movie button
28mm wide-angle lens (5x optical zoom, 4x digital zoom and 20x combined zoom) with optical image stabilizer
16.0 MP Image Sensor, DIGIC 4 Image Processor, 5x Optical Zoom, 28mm Wide-Angle lens
720p HD video recording with a dedicated movie button
Smart AUTO with 32 predefined shooting situations, Digital IS reduces effect of camera shake and subject movement
Scene Modes for creative shots like Fisheye Effect, Toy Camera Effect, Monochrome, and more.
Help Button provides simple explanations and easy controls of your settings
ProductInfo.Name: Canon PowerShot A810 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 5x Digital Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens with 720p HD Video Recording (Black)
